TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains properties and methods to provide consistent look and feel to all root designers on a workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Typically, an instance of a sequential workflow root designer class is created when a workflow is created in a workflow designer and it represents the designer surface on which users can add and edit activities. A workflow root designer does not have a parent designer unless it is the child of an <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity> activity. All workflow root designers must derive from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanBeParentedTo(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner parentActivityDesigner) cil managed
Public Overrides Function CanBeParentedTo (parentActivityDesigner As CompositeActivityDesigner) As Boolean

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a can be set as the parent of the activity associated with the designer.
Docs.returns: to allow the activity associated with to be the parent of the activity associated with the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Root designers cannot have a parent activity designer on a workflow design surface. Unless overridden in an inheriting class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.CanBeParentedTo%2A> returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property CanExpandCollapse As Boolean
public: virtual property bool CanExpandCollapse { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer can be expanded and collapsed.
Docs.value: if the can be expanded and collapsed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless overridden in a deriving class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.CanExpandCollapse%2A> is always set to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property Footer As SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter

Docs.summary: Gets the footer associated with the root designer.
Docs.value: The that represents the footer associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The contents of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Footer%2A> appear at the bottom of the root designer on the workflow design surface. Icons and text can be displayed in the footer, including button icons that change the designer view when a user selects one of them.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<valuetype System.Drawing.Point> GetInnerConnections(valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges edges) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetInnerConnections (edges As DesignerEdges) As ReadOnlyCollection(Of Point)

Docs.param: The on which to gather the collection of connection points.
Docs.summary: Returns a read-only collection of points that represent the inner connection of the designer.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains the objects used for a connectable designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A designer can have connectors within it.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of glyphs that are displayed on the .
Docs.value: An that contains the glyphs displayed on the .

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property Header As SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter

Docs.summary: Gets the header associated with the root designer.
Docs.value: The that represents the header associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The contents of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A> appear at the top of the root designer on the workflow design surface. Icons and text can be displayed in the header, including text that indicates the designer view that is currently displayed on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Image As Image
public: virtual property System::Drawing::Image ^ Image { System::Drawing::Image ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the image associated with the designer.
Docs.value: The to associate with the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Image%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Drawing.Image> to display. You can do this at design time or at run time.
Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Image%2A> returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property ImageRectangle As Rectangle
protected: virtual property System::Drawing::Rectangle ImageRectangle { System::Drawing::Rectangle get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value for the enclosing bounds of the image associated with the designer in logical coordinates.
Docs.value: A that encloses the displayed for the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.ImageRectangle%2A> to retrieve the coordinates for the rectangle that encloses the image associated with the designer. You can use these coordinates for drawing connectors or overlaying graphics.
## Examples The following example shows how to override the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.ImageRectangle%2A> property. In this example, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.ImageRectangle%2A> is calculated using the Bounds of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
[!code-csharp[wf_samples#74](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#74)] [!code-vb[wf_samples#74](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#74)]

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum size for the .
Docs.value: A that represents the minimum size of the sequential workflow designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.MinimumSize%2A> represents the smallest size to which a user can resize the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnPaint(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnPaint (e As ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs)

Docs.param: The that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Draws any headers and footers associated with the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.OnPaint%2A> draws any text to include in the headers and footers with the appropriate theme settings. It also draws any images to include in the headers and footers.
**Note** When you override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.OnPaint%2A> in a derived class, be sure to call the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnPaint%2A> method of the base class so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged(bool visible) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged (visible As Boolean)

Docs.param: to display smart tags on the designer surface; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Notifies the designer whether smart tags are to be shown or hidden on the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When called, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged%2A> invalidates the text rectangle associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A>.
**Note** When you override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged%2A> in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged%2A> method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property ShowSmartTag As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool ShowSmartTag { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the root designer displays smart tags.
Docs.value: if the displays smart tags; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A> property is not set to a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) and the corresponding <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter.Text%2A> property is not an empty string or set to a null reference (`Nothing`), <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.ShowSmartTag%2A> returns `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property SmartTagRectangle As Rectangle
protected: virtual property System::Drawing::Rectangle SmartTagRectangle { System::Drawing::Rectangle get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the rectangle on the designer surface in which to display a smart tag.
Docs.value: A that defines the bounds in which to display the smart tag.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ShowSmartTag%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.SmartTagVerbs%2A> to display a smart tag of available <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.DesignerActions%2A> at the location specified by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.SmartTagRectangle%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Text As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the description associated with the designer.
Docs.value: A string that contains the description associated with the designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless overridden in an inheriting class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Text%2A> returns <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property TitleHeight As Integer
protected: virtual property int TitleHeight { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the title area of the designer.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the height of the title area of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A root designer title area typically contains the header and any icon associated with the designer.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.TitleHeight%2A> calculates the integer it returns by getting the value of its base implementation and adding the height integer defined for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A>.
